Multiple Linear Regression In R

24 Nov 2014

At the time I was putting together some slides on an introduction to R, I wanted to integrate something very basic about linear modelling. But very soon I realized that this would be too much material for one series of slides. Hence I decided to put away the material on linear models for a separate post and a new series of slides.

The introduction to multiple linear regression comes in two versions. First, an example analysis of the Chatterjee–Price Attitude dataset is described in a blog post. Second, the same material is also presented as a series of slides which can freely be used for courses or presentations.

Disclaimer

The description of the multiple linear regression analysis is based on a course on Computational Statistics taught by Martin Mächler and Peter Bühlmann at ETH Zurich. The course notes contain more topics than just multiple linear regression and are certainly worth while having a look at. I want to thank both authors for this course and for sharing their course notes online.
